<title level="1" pfs="">[Clockwork Puppeteer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1981)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Clockwork puppeteers are grim constructs capable of controlling corpses like puppets. They typically stand 12 feet tall and have spindly legs and long arms ending with scalpel-like claws. Dozens of metallic strings, composed of interlocking clockwork links, hang from their wrists.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)): DC 32

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 30

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 27
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 12">[Clockwork Puppeteer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1981)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Clockwork" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=331" />
<trait label="Construct" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=35" />
<trait label="Mindless" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=108" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #180: The Smoking Gun](/Sources.aspx?ID=125) pg. 81</row>

**Perception** +20; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +6

**Con** +2

**Int** -5

**Wis** +2

**Cha** -5
</row>

**Wind Up** 24 hours, DC 22, standby

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 33 

**Fort** +22 

**Ref** +25 

**Will** +19 

</row>

**HP** 205

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poisoned](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

**Resistances**
physical 10 (except [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374) or orichalcum)

**Weaknesses**
[electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 10, [orichalcum](/Equipment.aspx?ID=378) 10

**Clockwork Swarm** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206)) 30 feet. A cloud of flying, spiderlike clockworks surrounds the clockwork puppeteer. A creature that ends its turn in the cloud takes 4d8 piercing damage (DC 29 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet, climb 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +24,
**Damage** 3d10+9 slashing

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
string +24 ([range 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 3d8+9 slashing plus clockwork string

**Clockwork String**   Any creature hit by the puppeteer's string is [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20). The puppeteer can move while it has a creature grabbed with its string, but it automatically releases the creature if the puppeteer moves beyond the string's 60-foot length. The puppeteer can use up to six strings at a time. It can release any creature grabbed by a string as a free action. Each string has AC 30, and its [Escape](/Actions.aspx?ID=79) DC is 32. A string can be severed by a Strike that deals at least 20 slashing damage to it. This doesn't deal any damage to the clockwork puppeteer.

**Create Puppet** <actions string="Reaction" /> ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11)) **Trigger** A creature [grabbed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=20) by the puppeteer's clockwork string dies; **Effect** The triggering creature's body becomes infested with tiny clockworks. This puppet is fully under the clockwork puppeteer's control and has statistics identical to a [zombie](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=103) of its size with the following exceptions: It loses the [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160) trait, loses [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42), loses its weakness to positive damage, and gains the [construct](/Traits.aspx?ID=35) trait.

**Pull String** <actions string="Single Action" />  The puppeteer reins in a creature grabbed by its string. The puppeteer attempts an [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the puppeteer [pulls](/Rules.aspx?ID=451) the creature 15 feet closer to it (30 feet closer on a critical success).

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Clockwork Free Will</title>

Although mindless, clockwork puppeteers display an unusual ability to reason and make choices independently. This appearance of free will is, however, merely an illusion. In truth, a puppeteer's clockwork “brain” is so complex it bears a powerful semblance of agency. Creating these brains is a taxing and expensive endeavor, which is why clockwork puppeteers are among the rarest kinds of clockwork.
</aside>
